sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 24 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C24, the alternating group A5, or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 24 exist?
message_2:
There are 15 non-isomorphic groups of order 24. These groups can be classified using the Sylow theorems and considering the possible structures of the Sylow subgroups. The groups are:

1. Z_24 (cyclic group)
2. Z_12 × Z_2
3. Z_8 × Z_3
4. Z_6 × Z_4
5. Z_4 × Z_2 × Z_2
6. Z_3 × (Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2)
7. Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_2 × Z_3
8. S_4 (symmetric group on 4 elements)
9. A_4 × Z_2 (alternating group on 4 elements)
10. SL(2, Z_3) (special linear group)
11. Z_4 ⋊ Z_6
12. Z_3 ⋊ Z_8
13. Z_3 ⋊ Q_8 (quaternion group)
14. Z_2 × S_3 × Z_2
15. Z_2 × A_4

These groups have different structures and properties, and they are not isomorphic to each other.
